article.headline: USC runs past Washington State 79-68
article.story: PULLMAN, Wash. -- Byron Wesley scored 20 second half points -- ending the night with 31 -- as Southern California beat Washington State 79-68 on Thursday to end a 10-game losing streak. Southern California (11-19, 2-15 Pac-12) outscored Washington State 40-20 in the paint and out-rebounded the Cougars 40-34. DaVonte Lacy had 20 points and 10 rebounds, and went 7 of 8 from the foul line, for Washington State (9-20, 2-15 Pac-12) to lead four Cougars in double figures. D.J. Shelton added 11 points and 11 rebounds for his eleventh double-double of the season. Southern California started the game with a quick 10-2 lead, but Washington State ended the half with a 36-35 edge. The Cougars came out in the second with back-to-back three's from Lacy and Dexter Kernich-Drew to jump out to a nine-point lead, 44-35, at the 18 minute mark. The Cougars offense looked to be in rhythm, but the Trojans defense stopped the run and quickly erased the lead with a 16-2 run of their own to go ahead 51-46 with 12:46 left. Wesley scored nine of the Trojans' points in the run. WSU went cold from the field and struggled with the Trojans press. The Trojans extended the run to 21-6 for a 67-52 lead with 6:45 remaining. Washington State hit only two from the field in the stretch. Washington State shot 44 percent in the first half and only 29 percent from the field (9 of 31) in the second half. USC shot 54 percent in the second half (51 percent overall) and hit four of nine from the 3-point line. This is the first road win for Southern California and the eighth straight loss for Washington State.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
